alttext: Magic Monkey â€¢ Godiego â€¢ 1980 â€¢ A childhood favorite from when I lived in Kagoshima, Japan. Apparently Apple Music has heard of Godiego, so hey! Good work, Apple! â€¢ Loved It!
Dive â€¢ Artist: Almost Monday â€¢ I heard "Can't Slow Down" in a 7-Eleven, that's literally how I discovered this album and band Not my usual, but good! â€¢ Liked It

Affection â€¢ 2020 â€¢ Bugseed â€¢ I don't know how I ran across Bugseed. I have zero memory of it. All I know is, this is wonderful lo-fi funk, perfect for programming, zoning out, or just forgetting the hellscape that is 2025. Can recommend. â€¢ Liked It

Passive Aggressive Robot - Single â€¢ 2022 â€¢ Rinzen â€¢ A two song single release that is great for inclusion in a workout mix or just anytime you want to hear electronic or dance music. â€¢ Loved It!

The Jazz Influence: Electronic Jazz Compiled by Kevin Yost â€¢ 2006 â€¢ Various Artists â€¢ I don't know if you ever listen to modern eclectic jazz, if that's even a thing, but it's great. This is a nice up and downbeat album - again, is that even a thing? But it is, and it's great. â€¢ Loved It!

Now I appreciate some of it. Yumi Matsutoya is right on the edge of liking and only wanting in small doses. ðŸ˜„ â€¢ Liked It

Trilogy (The Best Of) â€¢ 2015 â€¢ Bitter:Sweet â€¢ I don't even know what genre this is, but I like it. Bitter:Sweet is featured on "Martini Bar Essentials" on Apple Music, so consider that. But I don't care. I like it. â€¢ Loved It!

Any Day â€¢ 2018 â€¢ The Sea and Cake â€¢ A lot of alternative sounds the same, and it's annoying about it. I stumbled across these guys by accident somehow, and they don't strike me that way. A nice summer evening listen with a Honey Ale or a Coffee Stout. â€¢ Liked It
Alto's Odyssey (Original Game Soundtrack) - EP â€¢ 2018 â€¢ Todd Baker & Torin Borrowdale â€¢ Yeah, it's a weird thing to like but (just like the game) the music is SO good! â€¢ Loved It!
Big Calm â€¢ 1998 â€¢ Morcheeba â€¢ This album ranges from mellow and dreamy to intense and attitudinal. It's a must. And omg, Skye Edwards is amazing!  â€¢ Loved It!
Bye Bye â€¢ Jpn 2022 â€¢ Mr. Shira â€¢ I don't even know how to categorize this. It's like Japanese LoFi or something. It's weird and wonderful. â€¢ Loved It!
Caves â€¢ 2020 â€¢ Rocket Empire â€¢ Rocket Empire is great. Caves is downtempo, serene goodness. Very glad I stumbled across this. â€¢ Loved It!
Flashback â€¢ 2000 â€¢ Electric Light Orchestra â€¢ Let's face it, not everything ELO did is magic (strange or otherwise). But their highs are so high. A great look back. â€¢ Liked It

Fly From Here â€¢ 2011 â€¢ Yes â€¢ You may not have heard this. You may not have been aware that Yes was still doing great work in 2011. But they were, and this is (I think) one of their best. â€¢ Loved It!
